subject: Re: Mike's Box 12.470 Proto 1
author: psi_research
full_text:
LC, how did you plug the 469 into your Olympus? Did you just plug the
audio from the 469 headphone jack into the mic line in on your
recorder? I've been hesitant to try this as i didn't want to to
overload the mic in jack on my recorder. Thanks, Bill

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Mike,
> 
> Today I modified my Radio Shack 12-469, but have some questions.  It 
> was easy to do, and I instantly plugged it into my Olympus voice 
> recorder and recorded off of it easily.  Now I want to pipe some 
> white noise in (and ambient), as well. 
> 
> 1) Is the set-up in your video what has worked best for you (with the 
> computer and all)?
> 2) Will you tell us what free computer programs you used (I think one 
> is Audacity)?
> 3) What microphone and white noise generator did you use for your 
> travel pack unit pictured on UFOGeek.com (posted on December 8th)?  
> And can you give me a layout for the wiring of it - you know, how it 
> all hooks together?  I'll figure it out sooner or later, but I'd 
> rather it be sooner!
> 
> Thanks, LC
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "M.A. Coletta (Mike)" 
> <michaelcoletta@> wrote:
> >
> > I am currently putting together another video, just like my others 
> > showing a very practical way to use the Radio Shack Hack devices.
> > You probably saw my 12-469 practical use videos, now I'm going to 
> be 
> > sharing a 12-470 practical use video.  This one is of a totally 
> > portable system that uses a noise generator, the hacked 12-470, a 
> > digital (or analog) recorder, and a microphone which gathers the 
> raw 
> > audio sweep, white noise (or in my case a special white/pink noise 
> file 
> > I created), and any ambient noise within a chamber.. and places 
> that 
> > session int a .wav file.  It also includes an ear piece so you can 
> > hear, real time, what the digital recorder is recording (the mixer 
> of 
> > the session sound within the chamber).
> > Stay tuned for that video later today....
> > 
> > - Mike
> > All my Radio Shack Hack videos can be found at
> > http://www.ufogeek.com
> >
>
